description_templates.default: Enable `clone-remote-port` (or manually set `bedrock port` to the Java port), and connect with the Java IP and port.
description_templates.ip_and_port: Enable `clone-remote-port` (or manually set `bedrock port` to the Java port), uncomment `bedrock address`, and change `0.0.0.0` to your Java server's IP. Connect with the Java IP and port.
description_templates.java_ip: Make sure your remote address is 'auto', uncomment `bedrock address`, and change `0.0.0.0` to your Java server's IP.

built_in.name: Aternos
built_in.description:
Select as a plugin in the Aternos plugin list and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [Aternos's article](https://support.aternos.org/hc/en-us/articles/360051047631) for more details. 
 Do note: Aternos automatically installs the latest version of the plugin, but does not auto update it. To update Geyser on aternos, simply reinstall the plugin (no need to uninstall the plugin/deleting the plugin files).

built_in.name: Apex Hosting
built_in.description: Full auto installation. Go to the `Customizations` tab in the panel and select `Enabled` under the `Geyser Auto Installer` option then restart and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [Apex's article](https://apexminecrafthosting.com/geysermc/) for more details.

built_in.name: Cloud Nord
built_in.description: Go to their [Crossplay Server](https://cloudnord.net/minecraftcrossplay-server-hosting/) hosting section and simply order your server. Instructions on how to join are provided.

built_in.name: CreeperHost
built_in.description: Has a toggle within the control panel to automatically enable Geyser. May not be enabled by default, so you may need to toggle it and restart the server.

built_in.name: Cubes Hosting
built_in.description: Install Geyser as a plugin from the plugin manager configure with the correct port then restart the server and Geyser works out of the box as expected.

built_in.name: exaroton
built_in.description: Select as a plugin in the exaroton plugin list and connect to your server with your Java IP and port. See [exaroton's article](https://support.exaroton.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019857918-Geyser) for more details.

built_in.name: FreeMcServer.net
built_in.description: Can be selected from the reinstall tab of the control panel.

built_in.name: GGServers
built_in.description: Can easily be installed to any server in just one click from their auto plugin setups. No configuration needed.

built_in.name: MCProHosting
built_in.description: Click "Enable Bedrock Support" on the server dashboard and follow the steps. For manual installation: Add Destination Port 19132 with Protocol UDP to the port forward mapping and connect to the given source port.

built_in.name: Minefort
built_in.description: On the server dashboard under "Connect Support", make sure "Allow Bedrock" is enabled. Then simply connect via `play.minefort.com` and join using `/server <servername>`, or connect via `<servername>.minefort.com`.

built_in.name: Minehut
built_in.description: Connect via `bedrock.minehut.com` and do `/join <servername>`, or connect directly via `<servername>.bedrock.minehut.gg`.

built_in.name: OMGServ
built_in.description: Select Geyser in [Install Menu](https://i.imgur.com/Gewpsrq.png), all is automatically installed. You can turn on/off floodgate in [server properties on the dashboard](https://i.imgur.com/jg5mzNj.png).

built_in.name: PloudOS
built_in.description: Connect via `geyser.ploudos.com` and enter the with your Java IP and port. See [PloudOS's article](https://ploudos.com/faq/#How-do-I-connect-from-Bedrock-to-a-Java-server) for more details.

built_in.name: Pufferfish Host
built_in.description: Geyser is installed and configured on all servers by default.

built_in.name: Server.pro
built_in.description: On VPS, select Geyser in the [Service Type Menu](https://i.imgur.com/loSNmvu.png), Floodgate can be enabled and disabled on the dashboard configuration. For manual installation: If using a Premium or Free plan, use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in the configuration file and connect with the same port; for the Free plan, also enable the `clone-remote-port` option; leave the IP values as default (`0.0.0.0` and `auto`). However, if you are using a PRO or a VPS plan, you can use any port you'd like, which can be opened on the Firewall tab.

built_in.name: Snakecraft Hosting
built_in.description: Select "Paper + Geyser with Floodgate" under the Jar Type at checkout to install the Geyser plugin. Players will Connect with the same IP and port as you would on Java.

built_in.name: SRKHOST
built_in.description: You can enable Geyser at the Version changer page. This feature is built-in and uses the given port by the host.

built_in.name: Virtual Gladiators
built_in.description: Find the plugin in the control panel under the "VG Recommended" category and restart your server. IP and port are the same as Java.

built_in.name: ZapHosting
built_in.description: Find the plugin in the control panel and restart your server. IP and port is the same as Java.

built_in.name: 365Hosts
built_in.description: Go to their [Minecraft: Crossplay](https://www.365hosts.com/gaming/crossplayminecraft) hosting section and simply order your server. Instructions on how to join are provided.

support.name: Aquatis
support.description: Need to open a support ticket to get a UDP port, then use that as the `bedrock port`.

support.name: BisectHosting
support.description: You must have a plan with a dedicated IP. In Geyser's config, uncomment the bedrock address field and set it to the public IP of your server (e.g. `address: 51.79.129.18`). Leave the port as `19132`. Under the home tab, select 'Enable UDP Network' and restart the server. See Bisect's [article](https://www.bisecthosting.com/clients/index.php?rp=/knowledgebase/193/How-to-install-Geyser-and-Floodgate-on-a-Minecraft-Java-server.html) for full instructions.

support.name: Craft-Hosting
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port; note that this provider appears to only provide service in Russia.

support.name: DedicatedMC
support.description: Need to ask to open the default bedrock port.

support.name: FadeHost
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port or buy a dedicated IP address to support a different port.

support.name: FakaHeda
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port or use one of the available ports allocated for your server, for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: FalixNodes
support.description: Open a port yourself on the network page in the game panel, then use that port in the bedrock section of the Geyser config.

support.name: Ferox Hosting
support.description: Open a port yourself in their panel and check out the [knowledgebase article](https://feroxhosting.nl/kb/) for how to install and configure Geyser.

support.name: GPortal
support.description: Need to ask to open a UDP port, then use that in the config. Also, make sure your `bedrock` `address` in your Geyser config is your server IP.

support.name: Heavynode
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port. To resolve further connection issues, see [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser)

support.name: Hicoria
support.description: Use the one of the available ports allocated for your server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: HostEZ
support.description: Geyser plugin supported with self-install or installed on request with its own port. Includes firewall tested to be compatible with Geyser.

support.name: HumbleServers
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port, or to one of the two extra ports, and connect with that port. If the subdomain doesn't work, use your regular numbered IP address.

support.name: Meloncube
support.description: Contact the support for a UDP port to use for Geyser. Set that port as the `bedrock port`, and connect with it

support.name: Netbela
support.description: Install Geyser as a plugin with the dedicated Plugin installer. Use the same port as your Java server in your config. Connect using the same address and port as your Java server.

support.name: NFOservers
support.description: Set your remote address and your bedrock address to the server IP in the Geyser config file. As an alternative, you can run Geyser standalone separately on an Unmanaged VDS.

support.name: NiCraft
support.description:
Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.
  - To fix connection issues, [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser).
  - So if your players encounter this issue, please ask them to try to connect (even if they don't have Minecraft) from Java Edition first while their Bedrock client is opened, and after they should be able to join on Bedrock Edition.

support.name: Nitrado
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Add 4 to the Port of the Java server. See [here](https://wiki.nitrado.net/en/How_to_install_GeyserMC_and_Floodgate) for specific instructions.

support.name: Nodecraft
support.description: Use the default server port and 0.0.0.0 or your server IP as the host address.

support.name: Oracle Cloud / OCI
support.description:
[Tutorial for a Minecraft server in Oracle Cloud](https://blogs.oracle.com/developers/post/how-to-set-up-and-run-a-really-powerful-free-minecraft-server-in-the-cloud)
  - Note: You'll need to also allow port 19132 on UDP in both the security list and the firewall-cmd command.
 -- Note for Ubuntu users: Comment out `-A INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited` in `/etc/iptables/rules.v4` and run `sudo iptables-restore < /etc/iptables/rules.v4` to fix ufw.

support.name: OVH
support.description: To fix firewall issues blocking UDP connections, see [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#issues-connecting-with-ovh-or-a-subsidiary).

support.name: Pebblehost
support.description: See [this video](https://youtu.be/v9lC80UBZF4) for a PebbleHost-specific tutorial.

support.name: PUBCS
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port, or upgrade to a plan that includes dedicated IP address to support a different port.

support.name: Revivenode
support.description:
Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port (either by setting it yourself, or enabling "clone-remote-port". Connect with the same IP and port as you would on Java. 
  - To fix random `Unable to Connect` issues, see [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser).
  - Alternatively, if your players encounter this issue, please ask them to try to connect from Java Edition first while in the same network, and after, they should be able to join on Bedrock Edition.

support.name: SunriseNode - TODO
support.description: Get Geyser as a plugin. Use the same port as your Java server for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: Shockbyte
support.description: Use the same address and port as your Java server for the Bedrock address and port in your config and connect with that port. For Geyser Standalone installation instructions, see [here](https://shockbyte.com/billing/knowledgebase/173/Introduction-to-GeyserMCorDragonProxy-How-GeyserMC-Works.html).

support.name: Skynode.pro
support.description: Go to "Server Details", add a new port, and change the port in your config. Connect with that, using the address from your main port.

support.name: SoYouStart
support.description: Please see [here](https://wiki.geysermc.org/geyser/fixing-unable-to-connect-to-world/#bedrock-players-can-connect-after-hitting-the-server-on-a-tcp-port-eg-on-java-or-a-website-on-the-same-server-or-only-people-who-also-play-on-java-edition-can-join-from-geyser) to fix Bedrock edition connections.

support.name: StellaNode
support.description: Open a support ticket on the billing panel to receive an additional UDP port for Geyser, then set that as the Bedrock port.

support.name: STIPE
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port; note that this provider only provides service in Australia.

support.name: SyntexHosting
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port, or request a (free) additional port for your bedrock clients.

support.name: The Minecraft Hosting
support.description: Try using 19132 as the Bedrock port, if that does not work, use the same Java server's port for the Bedrock port in your config and connect with that port.

support.name: Vultam
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port, or request an additional port. The additional port can be 19132 if you buy a dedicated IP.

support.name: WinterNode
support.description: Set the Bedrock port to the Java server's port and connect with that port. Alternatively, request an additional port, or buy a dedicated IP address.

support.name: WitherHosting
support.description: Either use the Java server's port, or create a port in the ports manager on the panel and use that for Bedrock. Refer to the hosts [support article](https://support.witherhosting.com/en/article/how-to-install-and-use-geysermc-1xn5l6v/) for more

no_support.name: MyArena
no_support.description: Does seem to be working, but the Java version is too old in order for Geyser to run properly.

no_support.name: Feather
no_support.description: Their proxy network does not support UDP. Therefor Geyser is not supported - as an alternative, set up a paper server with e.g. playit.gg instead of port forwarding.
